overview:
Over the course of the last decade and a half, Stephen Meade has contributed to the creation of 11 successful technology-based companies.

The founder of Cenoplex, a company dedicated to more effective and intelligent customer messaging and communications for wireless operators, Stephen also serves as chairman and resident rainmaker at BigBamboo LLC, a holding company which incubates start-up companies.

At BigBamboo, he guides the future of companies including MonetaPro, RONAStar, ComCom and OrionNation. His roster of successful businesses includes the founding and selling of SiteVisions.com, a website and database development company sold in 2000, and VirtualSeller.com, started in 1996, which became an innovator for an ecommerce-based transaction processing system that proved to be an early precursor to PayPal.

Prior to venturing into entrepreneurial world, he was a regional vice president with Travelers Group, a fortune 500 financial services company.

Stephen frequently speaks at executive leadership conferences such as CGI (Clinton Global Initiative), Founder Institute, and Opportunity Green.

He is also the author of three books in the field of finance/credit improvement and business networking, a guest lecturer at universities including MIT, Harvard, Northwestern, PKI, UMKC, USC , and UCLA, and serves as an advisor to numerous companies and organizations.

His “Isolation Is A Good Thing” seminar trains executives how to isolate exactly what and who they need to be for success.
